titles.title: OMAR Act

To amend the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 to prohibit a candidate for election for Federal office from using amounts contributed to the candidate's campaign to make payments to any vendor owned or controlled by an immediate family member of the candidate.
Obstructing Monetary Allocations to Relatives Act
OMAR Act

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on House Administration.

bill.summary:
Obstructing Monetary Allocations to Relatives Act or the OMAR Act
This bill prohibits a candidate for election to federal office from using amounts contributed to the candidate's campaign to make payments to vendors owned or controlled by an immediate family member of the candidate.
